result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John H. Bagley

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Defendant John H. Bagley in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for John H. Bagley.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for an offer.
State will route the file for an offer.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:21 AM Defendant John H. Bagley in court with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha detective, Michelle Trussoni sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Nickolie.  Cross examination by Atty. Ahmad.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Nickolie makes closing statements and moves for bind over.  Atty. Ahmad makes closing statements.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims (except through his attorney) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant may engage in contracting for services but he is not to be invoved in any of the invoicing or accounting for any monies paid into the LLC and that is to be handled by Glynn Accounting Services.

08:42 AM Defendant John H. Bagley in court with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.
